snippet: An examination by The New York Times into an enormous data theft shows that Target’s system was particularly vulnerable to attack.
abstract: Investigation into enormous data theft at Target reveals intricate scheme by Eastern European hackers who exploited a system that was particularly vulnerable to attack; hackers implemented malware that gathered card information during Thanksgiving weekend, remaining undetected for weeks until company was notified by the Secret Service.

byline.original: By ELIZABETH A. HARRIS, NICOLE PERLROTH, NATHANIEL POPPER and HILARY STOUT
byline.contributor: Elizabeth A. Harris reported from Minneapolis, Nicole Perlroth from San Francisco, and Nathaniel Popper and Hilary Stout from New York. Matt Apuzzo contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: An examination by The New York Times into an enormous data theft shows that Target’s system was particularly vulnerable to attack.

headline.main: A Sneaky Path Into Target Customers’ Wallets
headline.print_headline: A Sneaky Path Into Target Customers’ Wallets
